intro: Pedicularis jacquinii, commonly known as the Jacob's ladder, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The plant is characterized by its whorled arrangement of leaves and clusters of spurred flowers that range in color from pink to red. It typically grows in alpine or subalpine habitats, often in rocky or well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation efforts.
